title: Analysis of function with diff. eq.

content.question:
Let f be a function that is differentiable throughout its domain and that has the following properties.

(i) <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhacqGHRaWkcaWG5baacaGLOaGa ayzkaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaa8aabaWdbiaadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGaam iEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgUcaRiaadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamyE aaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaiabgkHiTiaadAgadaqada WdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGa amyEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaaaaa@4DA6@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for all real numbers x, y, and x + y in the domain of f 

(ii) <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaCbeaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiGacYgacaGGPbGaaiyBaaWcpaqaa8qacaWGObGaeyOK H4QaaGimaaWdaeqaaOWdbiaadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiAaaGaay jkaiaawMcaaiabg2da9iaaicdaaaa@423B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

(iii) <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </munder> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mi>h</mi> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaCbeaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiGacYgacaGGPbGaaiyBaaWcpaqaa8qacaWGObGaeyOK H4QaaGimaaWdaeqaaOWdbmaalaaapaqaa8qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aaba WdbiaadIgaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaa8aabaWdbiaadIgaaaGaeyypa0Ja aGymaaaa@4377@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

(a) Show that f(0) = 0.

frqParts.text:
Let f be a function that is differentiable throughout its domain and that has the following properties.

(i) <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhacqGHRaWkcaWG5baacaGLOaGa ayzkaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaa8aabaWdbiaadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGaam iEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgUcaRiaadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamyE aaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaiabgkHiTiaadAgadaqada WdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGa amyEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaaaaa@4DA6@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for all real numbers x, y, and x + y in the domain of f 

(ii) <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaCbeaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiGacYgacaGGPbGaaiyBaaWcpaqaa8qacaWGObGaeyOK H4QaaGimaaWdaeqaaOWdbiaadAgadaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiAaaGaay jkaiaawMcaaiabg2da9iaaicdaaaa@423B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

(iii) <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </munder> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mi>h</mi> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaCbeaeaaqa aaaaaaaaWdbiGacYgacaGGPbGaaiyBaaWcpaqaa8qacaWGObGaeyOK H4QaaGimaaWdaeqaaOWdbmaalaaapaqaa8qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aaba WdbiaadIgaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaa8aabaWdbiaadIgaaaGaeyypa0Ja aGymaaaa@4377@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

(a) Show that f(0) = 0.

(b) Use the definition of the derivative to show that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Indicate clearly where properties (i), (ii) and (iii) are used.
(c) Find f(x) by solving the differential equation in part (b).

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
